Vulnerability.Title: slapi-nis bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The slapi-nis packages contain the NIS server plug-in and the Schema Compatibility plug-in for use with the 389 Directory Server. The slapi-nis packages have been upgraded to upstream version 0.54, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version, including the support for the ID Views feature, which is required for one of the major Red Hat Enterprise Linux Identity Management features. (BZ#1151436) This update also fixes the following bugs: Due to incorrect default settings, directory servers that were configured to provide host address information in the form of NIS "hosts.byname" and "hosts.byaddr" maps produced map entry values in which the first field was a host name instead of an IP address. Consequently, clients ignored the value obtained from the NIS server and proceeded as if no matching entry was found in the NIS map. With this update, the default settings have been corrected, and clients are now able to parse host address information retrieved from servers that are configured to provide it. (BZ#1090948) Previously, slapi-nis transformed uppercase characters in an Active Directory (AD) domain name into lowercase characters. As a consequence, searching for user groups using the ldapsearch command could return incomplete results because the LDAP search filter is case-sensitive. A patch has been applied to fix this problem, and the search for user groups now returns complete results when an AD domain name contains uppercase characters. (BZ#1130131) Users of slapi-nis are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
